body.p:
To his Excellency B Magoffin Esqr
govnor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Joseph Piefeffer stats that he was taken up by the Police court of Frankfort charged with Selling Whisky to A. W. Macklins negro & Fogg -- negro & Henry Murrys negro on Sunday morning between 5 & 6 oclock A. M. on the 3rd of February 1861 he S and also for his man Selling Whisky your Petitioner States that he has been unwell and thought he had the right for to direct his Slave to waite on any one that came in in the former cases his Roberts was in my house when the 3 negroes came in and I think will State that the negros got no whisky or anything else in my house your Petitioner States that he was fined $20 -- in each case before the police court on the 9th day of February 1861 Wherefore he prays that you would remit said fines amounting to $80.00 in all,
We aske that you remit the above fines as your Petitioner is a good citizen and tryes to do right

D. M. Jolley
James Shannon
J. Dudley
E.. H. Tole
Wm B Tremere
A F Payne
Jas P. O'Hara
Nelson Allay
W. H Greenup
A. Kuhr
J. M. Helms
B. F. Johnson
J. M. Withrow
If the Governor is satisfied that the liquor was not sold We think the fine ought to be remitted

John Bolgere Jr
L. W. Winter
H. R. Powell
Grant Green
W Vanlandingham
M. B. Chism
Joseph Pfeiffer
vs } Pet
Commonwealth
Respite 12 mo
Rejected
B. M
